section.title: Present simple with I, you, we and they (positive form)
section.sectiontitle: In the positive, we use I/you/we/they + verb.
section.text2a: We work in the centre of the city.

section.title: Present simple with I, you, we and they (negative form)
section.sectiontitle: In the negative, we use I/you/we/they do not. We usually use the short form.
section.text1: I do not work for a big company.
section.text1a: I don't work for a big company.
section.text2a: They don't work in the centre of the city.

section.title: Present simple with I, you, we and they (question form)
section.sectiontitle: With yes/no questions, we use Do + (I/you/we/they) + verb. The short answer is Yes, I/you/we/they do and No, I/you/we/they don't.
section.text1a: Do I live in a flat? Yes, I do.
section.text2a: Do they live with your parents? No, they don't.
section.sectiontitle2: With Wh- questions, we can use Where/What/Who + do + subject + verb.
